definitions: person who commands a ship or other vessel
leader of a sports team or organized group
commissioned officer ranking above lieutenant in military forces
examples: The captain navigated the ship through dangerous waters successfully
She became captain of the cruise liner after twenty years
He was elected captain of the football team unanimously
The debate team captain organized weekly practice sessions efficiently
Captain Martinez commanded the infantry company with exceptional skill
She received her captain's bars after three years of service

definitions: position or office of being a captain or leader
duration of time during which someone serves as captain
examples: She accepted the captaincy of the national cricket team proudly
His captaincy brought unprecedented success to the struggling club
During his captaincy, the team won three consecutive championships
Her captaincy lasted four years before she decided to retire

definitions: brief text accompanying and explaining an image or illustration
heading of a legal document stating parties and court involved
examples: The caption beneath the photograph identified all the participants
She wrote clever captions for her social media posts daily
The caption of the court document listed both plaintiff and defendant
Legal assistants carefully prepare captions for all filed documents

definitions: person held as prisoner or kept in confinement
audience unable to leave and forced to listen or watch
examples: The captives were held in the fortress for three months
Rescue teams successfully freed all captives from the compound
The delayed passengers became a captive audience for advertisements
Students form a captive audience during mandatory assembly presentations

definitions: condition of being imprisoned, confined, or kept under control against one's will
examples: The animals spent years in captivity before being released
He wrote memoirs about his captivity during the war years
Many species don't reproduce well in captivity despite optimal conditions
The hostages endured harsh conditions during their captivity

definitions: person who captures and holds another person prisoner or hostage
examples: The captors demanded a ransom for the businessman's release
She managed to escape from her captors after three days
His captors treated him well despite the difficult circumstances
The captors were arrested when police stormed the building

definitions: act of taking someone or something by force or skill
process of recording or preserving data, images, or moments digitally
examples: The capture of the fugitive ended a three-month manhunt
His capture occurred peacefully without any resistance or violence
The capture of high-resolution images requires specialized camera equipment
Data capture systems process thousands of transactions every minute

definitions: small intelligent monkey native to Central and South America
member of the Franciscan order wearing brown hooded robes
examples: Capuchin monkeys use tools to crack open nuts efficiently
The zoo's capuchin exhibit attracts thousands of visitors annually
The capuchin friar devoted his life to helping the poor
Capuchin monks established the mission in the sixteenth century

definitions: world's largest rodent native to South America, semi-aquatic and herbivorous
examples: The capybara swam gracefully across the river despite its size
Capybaras often socialize with many different animal species peacefully
A group of capybaras grazed near the water's edge
The capybara can remain underwater for up to five minutes

definitions: motor vehicle with four wheels powered by an engine
railway vehicle for carrying passengers or freight on tracks
examples: She bought her first car after graduating from college
The electric car charged overnight in the garage
The dining car served meals throughout the journey
Freight cars transported goods across the country efficiently

definitions: medium-sized wild cat with tufted ears native to Africa and Asia
examples: The caracal leaped six feet to catch the bird mid-flight
Caracals hunt primarily at night using their exceptional hearing
A caracal's distinctive ear tufts help with camouflage and communication
The wildlife sanctuary rescued an injured caracal from poachers

definitions: sweet confection made by heating sugar until it browns and develops flavor
light brown color resembling the shade of caramelized sugar
examples: She drizzled warm caramel over the vanilla ice cream
The chef prepared salted caramel for the dessert topping
Her hair was dyed a rich caramel color for autumn
The leather sofa came in caramel and chocolate options

definitions: hard protective outer shell covering the back of turtles, crustaceans, and arachnids
examples: The turtle withdrew into its carapace when sensing danger nearby
The crab's carapace provides protection from predators and environmental hazards
Scientists measured the carapace to determine the lobster's age
The fossilized carapace revealed details about prehistoric marine life

definitions: unit of weight for precious stones equal to 200 milligrams
measure of gold purity with 24 carats being pure gold
examples: The diamond ring featured a stunning two-carat center stone
Dealers weigh precious gems to the nearest hundredth carat
The necklace was made from eighteen-carat gold
Twenty-four carat gold is too soft for everyday jewelry

definitions: vehicle equipped for living in, towed behind a car for holidays
group of people or vehicles traveling together across desert or hostile regions
examples: They toured Europe in their caravan for three months
The caravan park offered electricity and water hookups
The merchant caravan crossed the Sahara carrying valuable goods
A caravan of refugees fled the conflict zone together

definitions: aromatic seed used as spice in cooking, especially in European cuisine
examples: She added caraway seeds to the rye bread dough
The sauerkraut was flavored with caraway and juniper berries
Caraway gives a distinctive flavor to many Eastern European dishes
Toast the caraway seeds before grinding for maximum flavor

definitions: organic compound of carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen that provides energy in food
examples: Athletes consume carbohydrates before competitions for sustained energy release
Complex carbohydrates digest more slowly than simple sugars
The dietitian recommended reducing refined carbohydrates for better health
Whole grains provide essential carbohydrates along with fiber and nutrients

definitions: chemical element essential to life, forming the basis of organic compounds
copy of a document made using carbon paper
examples: Carbon forms the backbone of all organic molecules
The carbon cycle regulates Earth's climate and ecosystems
She kept a carbon of every letter she typed
The carbon copy was filed for record keeping

definitions: device in internal combustion engines that mixes air with fuel for combustion
examples: The mechanic cleaned the carburetor to improve engine performance
Old motorcycles often require carburetor adjustments for different altitudes
He rebuilt the carburetor using a complete overhaul kit
The carburetor needed adjustment after installing the new exhaust

definitions: device in internal combustion engines that mixes air with fuel for combustion
examples: The vintage car's carburettor required careful tuning for optimal performance
He replaced the carburettor with a fuel injection system
The carburettor jets were clogged with old fuel deposits
British mechanics prefer spelling it carburettor rather than carburetor

definitions: substance or agent capable of causing cancer in living tissue through exposure
examples: Tobacco smoke contains numerous carcinogens that damage lung tissue
Workers must wear protection when handling known carcinogens
The study identified several carcinogens in processed meat products
Asbestos is a well-documented carcinogen banned in many countries

definitions: piece of stiff paper or plastic for various purposes
one of 52 pieces used in card games
plastic card used for payment or identification
examples: She wrote a thank-you card to her grandmother
The business card listed his contact information clearly
He drew the ace card from the shuffled deck
They played cards until late into the evening
She paid with her credit card at the restaurant
The security guard checked everyone's identification cards carefully

definitions: aromatic spice from seed pods used in Asian and Middle Eastern cuisine
examples: She added cardamom pods to the chai tea mixture
Green cardamom has a more delicate flavor than black
The baklava was perfumed with rose water and cardamom
Cardamom is one of the most expensive spices by weight

definitions: stiff material made from paper pulp used for boxes and packaging
examples: The delivery arrived in a large cardboard box yesterday
She used cardboard to create a school project display
Recycling cardboard reduces waste and saves natural resources significantly
The cardboard packaging protected the fragile items during shipping

definitions: knitted jacket or sweater that opens at the front with buttons or zipper
examples: She wore a cozy cardigan over her dress for warmth
His grandfather always wore the same wool cardigan daily
The cashmere cardigan cost more than her entire outfit
School uniforms included a navy cardigan with the school crest

definitions: high-ranking Catholic Church official ranking below the Pope
bright red songbird common in North America
something of fundamental importance or primary significance
examples: The cardinal conducted the Easter mass at the cathedral
Cardinals elect the new Pope during the papal conclave
A cardinal perched on the snowy branch outside her window
Male cardinals have brilliant red plumage while females are brown
Honesty is a cardinal virtue in all ethical systems
The cardinal directions are north, south, east, and west

definitions: medical doctor who specializes in diagnosing and treating diseases of the heart
examples: The cardiologist recommended immediate surgery to repair the valve
She consulted a cardiologist about her irregular heartbeat concerns
After his heart attack, he sees his cardiologist every three months
The cardiologist ordered an echocardiogram to assess heart function

definitions: branch of medicine dealing with disorders of the heart and blood vessels
examples: She decided to specialize in cardiology during her residency
The hospital's cardiology department has state-of-the-art diagnostic equipment
Recent advances in cardiology have improved heart attack survival rates
He published groundbreaking research in the field of pediatric cardiology

definitions: provision of what is necessary for health, welfare, and protection
feeling of worry, concern, or anxiety about something
professional services provided for health or social needs
examples: The garden thrived under her careful care and attention
Parents provide care for their children throughout their development
He doesn't have a care in the world since retiring
She expressed care about the project's environmental impact
The nursing home provides round-the-clock care for elderly residents
Child care costs consume a significant portion of working parents' income

definitions: occupation or profession followed as one's lifework over many years
swift forward movement of a vehicle or person
examples: Her career in medicine spanned over thirty successful years
He changed careers from law to teaching at age forty
The car careered down the hill with its brakes failing
The horse careered across the field at full gallop

definitions: person who provides direct care to children, elderly, or disabled individuals
examples: The caregiver helped the patient with daily activities and medication
Professional caregivers receive training in patient safety and comfort
Family caregivers often sacrifice their own needs for loved ones
The agency provides qualified caregivers for home health services

definitions: person employed to look after a building or property
person temporarily performing the duties of an office or position
examples: The school caretaker arrived early to unlock the gates
The caretaker maintained the grounds of the estate beautifully
The caretaker government managed affairs until elections were held
She served as caretaker manager while they recruited permanently

definitions: goods carried by ship, aircraft, or other large vehicle for commercial purposes
examples: The cargo ship transported containers across the Pacific Ocean
Inspectors examined the cargo for contraband at the port
The plane's cargo hold was filled with humanitarian aid supplies
Cargo insurance protects against loss during international shipping

definitions: large deer of Arctic regions, known as reindeer when domesticated
examples: The caribou herd migrated hundreds of miles across the tundra
Indigenous peoples have hunted caribou for thousands of years
Climate change affects caribou migration patterns and breeding grounds
A single caribou can travel over three thousand miles annually

definitions: drawing that humorously exaggerates someone's distinctive features
description or imitation that deliberately exaggerates for comic or critical effect
examples: The political caricature emphasized the senator's prominent nose
Street artists drew caricatures of tourists for twenty dollars
His acting was a caricature of method acting techniques
The novel presented a caricature of suburban life

definitions: artist who specializes in drawing exaggerated portraits for humorous or satirical effect
examples: The caricaturist captured her personality in just ten minutes
Political caricaturists influence public opinion through their satirical drawings
The newspaper hired a caricaturist for their editorial section
Famous caricaturists can command high fees for their original artwork

definitions: quality of showing kindness, concern, and willingness to help others
examples: Her caring nature made her an excellent pediatric nurse
The organization promotes caring attitudes toward environmental conservation
His caring response to the crisis earned widespread community respect
Teaching children caring behaviors starts with modeling empathy

definitions: vivid crimson pigment or dye obtained from cochineal insects or synthesized
examples: The artist mixed carmine with white to create pink tones
Carmine dye has been used in textiles for centuries
Food manufacturers use carmine as a natural red coloring agent
The sunset painted the clouds in shades of carmine and gold

definitions: killing of a large number of people in a violent and brutal way
examples: The battlefield carnage shocked even experienced war correspondents
Emergency responders dealt with the carnage from the multi-car accident
Historical accounts describe the carnage of ancient battles vividly
The documentary revealed the carnage caused by the natural disaster

definitions: cultivated flower with frilled petals in various colors, popular in bouquets
examples: She wore a pink carnation corsage to the dance
Carnations last longer than roses in flower arrangements
The florist recommended carnations for the wedding centerpieces
Red carnations symbolize love and admiration in many cultures

definitions: public festival with processions, music, dancing, and masquerading
traveling amusement show with rides, games, and entertainment
examples: Rio's carnival attracts millions of visitors every year
The carnival parade featured elaborate costumes and samba dancers
The summer carnival set up rides in the town square
Children won stuffed animals at the carnival game booths

definitions: animal that feeds primarily or exclusively on meat from other animals
examples: Lions are obligate carnivores requiring meat for survival
The carnivore's digestive system efficiently processes animal protein
Some plants are carnivores that trap and digest insects
Carnivores play essential roles in maintaining ecosystem balance

definitions: religious song traditionally sung at Christmas time
song of joy or praise, especially one sung in celebration
examples: The choir sang traditional carols at the Christmas service
Silent Night remains one of the most beloved carols worldwide
Birds sang their morning carols as dawn broke
The children's carol of laughter filled the playground

definitions: amusement park ride with decorated horses moving in a circle
rotating platform or device for displaying or accessing items
examples: Children lined up to ride the antique carousel horses
The carousel played traditional organ music as it turned
The baggage carousel at the airport stopped working suddenly
She organized her spices on a rotating carousel

definitions: large freshwater fish often raised in ponds for food, common in Asian cuisine
examples: The pond was stocked with carp for recreational fishing
Koi are ornamental varieties of carp bred for color
Asian carp have become an invasive species in American waterways
The restaurant specialized in traditional carp dishes

definitions: skilled worker who makes, repairs, and installs wooden structures and fixtures
examples: The carpenter built custom cabinets for the kitchen renovation
She apprenticed with a master carpenter for three years
Carpenters framed the house in just two weeks
The restoration required a carpenter skilled in historical techniques

definitions: skilled trade and craft of working with wood to construct buildings and furniture
examples: He learned carpentry from his father in the family workshop
Fine carpentry requires patience, precision, and quality materials
The vocational school offers a two-year carpentry program
Traditional Japanese carpentry uses no nails or screws

definitions: thick fabric floor covering typically attached wall-to-wall or as large rugs
examples: They installed new carpet throughout the upstairs bedrooms
The Persian carpet in the library was worth thousands
Red carpet events attract celebrities and media attention
The carpet needed professional cleaning after the flood

definitions: material used for carpets or the carpet covering of a floor
examples: The carpeting in the office building was replaced every decade
They chose neutral carpeting to appeal to potential buyers
Wall-to-wall carpeting provides insulation and reduces noise
The carpeting showed wear patterns in high-traffic areas

definitions: vehicle with wheels pulled by horses for transporting people
manner of holding and moving one's body, especially while walking
wheeled support or frame for moving or holding something heavy
examples: The wedding couple departed in an elegant horse-drawn carriage
Historic carriages are displayed in the transportation museum
Her graceful carriage reflected years of ballet training
The soldier maintained perfect carriage during the ceremony
The printer carriage moves back and forth during operation
The gun carriage allowed the cannon to be repositioned quickly
